#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Esker Trail
#Text=Esker Trail is found in Bird 's Hill Provincial Park which itself is 24 km northeast of Winnipeg , Manitoba .
#Text=Get in
#Text=From the main park entrance on Highway 59 , take the north park drive to Nimowin Road .
#Text=Turn left on Nimowin Road and take the first road to the left until reaching the large parking area .
#Text=The trail starts behind the restaurant
#Text=GPS Waypoints
#Text=Latitude and Longitude in this table are derived from GPS measurements taken on the trail .
#Text=Elevations are from Google Earth .
#Text=Trail Description
#Text=In this section , the bold numbers indicate total distance in kilometers from the start of the hike , while the numbers in brackets refer to a GPS waypoint in the table above .
#Text=While the trail surface is easy for walking , there are many areas that are often muddy or flooded , so waterproof hiking boats are a must .
#Text=Insect repellent is also a good idea , particularly for the return portion of the trail .
#Text=0.0 Walk past the front entrance of the restaurant at ( 1 ) .
#Text=The trail starts at ( 2 ) .
#Text=This area is riddled with lots of trails , many of which are predominantly used for cross-country skiing .
#Text=There are two marked hiking trails that start here , the Esker Trail and the Lime Kiln Trail .
#Text=Both follow the same path initially .
#Text=While there are many trail intersections , the Esker Trail is easy to follow , with a distinctive yellow sign pointing you in the right direction at every junction .
#Text=After a short portion of grassy trail which may require dodging around some parked horse-drawn sleds , the trail joins a wide dirt horse trail .
#Text=Watch where you step .
#Text=After 0.6 , at ( 3 ) , the trail branches left and becomes grassy again .
#Text=At ( 4 ) 0.8 , the esker and lime kiln trails split , with the esker trail veering left .
#Text=As with all junctions , this one is well marked .
#Text=At 2.5 you reach a clearing .
#Text=There is an outhouse ( 5 ) and a warming hut used by skiers in the winter .
#Text=The trail continues to the right , but first , take the path past the warming hut to a lookout tower ( 6 ) at 2.6 .
#Text=Interpretive signs at the base of the tower and at the top explain the geology of the area and point out sights that may be visible from the top .
#Text=It appears that the surrounding trees have grown up substantially since the tower was constructed , and much of the view is now obscured .
#Text=Bird 's Hill is the highest point within 30 km , rising 30 metres above the surrounding prairie .
#Text=Return to ( 5 ) and take the trail to the left .
#Text=The trail descends steeply and enters darker , denser forest where insects are more likely .
#Text=At ( 8 ) , 4.1 from the start , you find yourself proceeding parallel to the outbound trail .
#Text=At 4.8 you reach a 5-way intersection ( 9 ) .
#Text=Bear slightly right .
#Text=You will pass an equestrian arena at ( 10 ) .
#Text=The trail rejoins the outbound trail at ( 3 ) , 5.1 from the start .
#Text=Retrace your steps along the first part of the trail , reaching the parking lot after a total of 5.7 km .
